title: Fragment of a monumental Greek inscription
support: Fragment of a limestone slab, seemingly broken on all sides.

layout.p: Remains of two, possibly three lines in large regular characters

handNote.lettering: Described by Orsi as large, beautiful, geometric characters. Omicron appears full size; pi has verticals of equal length; sigma four bar with horizontal top and bottom strokes.

date._: later Hellenistic in form, but no precise date possible.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.

bibl.title: Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus
bibl.citation: G. Kaibel, Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, Additis Graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae Inscriptionibus, Inscriptiones Graecae Consilio et Auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae Editae. Volumen XIV., XIV (Berlin: Georgius Reimerus, 1890)
